text: The GOP will move President Trump’s convention speech to Jacksonville, Florida, after he demanded an event without social distancing rules https://t.co/1Cxvs2z2yG

name: nytimes
text: New York City’s public advocate, Jumaane Williams, has become a champion to many protesters who are demonstrating against police violence. Now some hope that he may run for mayor next year. https://t.co/tqKwKPIPYY

name: nytimes
text:
RT @anniekarni: Trump campaign officials, along w/Kushner, had previously been looking at a menu of options for a new party platform, including a slimmed down, one-page rewrite, as well as a reworking of the 66-page document the party passed in 2016.

https://t.co/texi6KYJku

name: nytimes
text: Stocks suffered their worst drop in nearly 3 months as the S&P 500 stock index fell 5.9% — just days after it had recouped its losses for the year https://t.co/ujDkhH4NW9

name: nytimes
text:
RT @jmartNYT: New: Trump is trying to ride a backlash that doesn’t exist 

And it grows more discordant every day as tradition-bound institutions, including his own party, scramble to keep up w public opinion

w @maggieNYT @katierogers 

https://t.co/hqj6FJXC9Z

name: nytimes
text: Attendees cannot sue the Trump campaign or the venue if they contract the coronavirus at his June 19 rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma https://t.co/T7ZvebmgGg

name: nytimes
text:
RT @katierosman: Amid a furor from former and current employees about The Wing's treatment of black and brown employees, Audrey Gelman resigned. 

https://t.co/RErZpxPtAQ

name: nytimes
text: As Georgia elections officials prepared to roll out an over $100 million high-tech voting system last year, experts warned that it was too convoluted and expensive. On Tuesday, that admonition appeared prescient. https://t.co/3FPOwXCxGR

name: nytimes
text: A man who ambushed a sheriff’s deputy on Wednesday in Paso Robles, California, was killed on Thursday after a standoff, the authorities said https://t.co/aZlyfC2E6L

name: nytimes
text:
RT @CatieEdmondson: Several Republicans are breaking with Trump on renaming military bases named after Confederate figures.

“The American people know these names have to go,” Speaker Nancy Pelosi said. The president “seems to be the only person left who doesn’t get it.”
https://t.co/3urCJfdWKT

name: nytimes
text: Audrey Gelman, the founder of the Wing, a women-only co-working space, resigned Thursday. Her departure came just before employees went on a virtual strike to protest her leadership and to ask for sweeping changes to the management of the Wing. https://t.co/lAaMT4KWEX

name: nytimes
text: RT @nytopinion: "It’s important to stop pretending that the progressive agenda is exclusively a mobilization agenda," @SeanMcElwee writes. "In fact, progressive ideas have a powerful ability to persuade voters to vote for Democrats." https://t.co/1socR2qjlF

name: nytimes
text: Joe Biden said the killing of George Floyd in police custody is having a larger global impact than the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s assassination in 1968. “Look at the millions of people marching around the world,” he said. https://t.co/dkWjGLE7gY https://t.co/p4lkaY7iAR

name: nytimes
text:
Gov. Kate Brown of Oregon said on Thursday that she was pausing efforts to reopen the state’s economy for a week because of a recent rise in coronavirus cases.

Live updates about the pandemic: https://t.co/42ZNebzaTc

name: nytimes
text: Seattle’s mayor defended allowing protesters police-free “autonomous zone” on the city’s streets, pushing back a day after President Trump threatened to send federal resources to crack down on the protesters, whom he labeled terrorists. https://t.co/Z18UoK8lVW https://t.co/5MRIFoCcTe

name: nytimes
text: The Czech Republic loosened its lockdown earlier than most countries in Europe — making it a laboratory for how the arts can adapt to our new reality. The drive-in theater at a large vegetable market in Prague is an ambitious example. https://t.co/8OKARTTJqW

name: nytimes
text: In Belgium, we visited one of the region's oldest gin manufacturers — now making a popular line of hand sanitizer. Even as the country reopens, the distillery is producing roughly twice as much hand sanitizer every week than gin. https://t.co/5xC0JMCxNS https://t.co/mTR2lXfukG

name: nytimes
text: In Amsterdam, though most professions will be back to work by July, sex workers have been mandated to wait until September — sending hundreds into poverty and forcing some to work in secret. "It's a disaster," one escort and union representative said. https://t.co/6OQQWhPWbq

name: nytimes
text: Many houses of worship have struggled to adapt to a socially distanced world. This is the solution one congregation in Denmark improvised. https://t.co/xjrBPYCd1I https://t.co/5utExatxmc

name: nytimes
text: Finally, in Stuttgart, Germany, orchestras play on in a deeply personal way — with an audience of one. Attendees sit opposite the musician and lock eyes for 60 seconds. "This made me feel free again," one double-bassist said. "Like the world is turning." https://t.co/xMR94oqmFM

name: nytimes
text: Take your own road trip through a resurfacing Europe with @PatrickKingsley and @laetitiavancon: https://t.co/LXpd61MAin https://t.co/lXhirMJNj1

name: nytimes
text: Asian financial markets fell on Friday but did not match the scale of Wall Street’s plunge the day before. Other indicators suggested the market’s swoon may be bottoming. https://t.co/0K7Ia3MUp0

name: nytimes
text: Europe morning briefing: Here's what you need to know to start your day https://t.co/HSADnApBDk

name: nytimes
text: America’s civic unrest has encouraged protests in Europe, where demonstrators have invoked the names of victims of police violence in their own countries as they demand systemic racism be redressed. Their calls have been met mostly with official denial. https://t.co/XfwdnyYyu1

name: nytimes
text: "I have always loved restaurants, but the last few months have shown me how much they act as a respite from the grind of daily life," writes Besha Rodell, a columnist for our Australia bureau https://t.co/Z4J7RRCZDm

name: nytimes
text:
India has added nearly 11,000 new virus cases, its biggest single-day rise so far, officials said on Friday. The country’s total confirmed caseload has now overtaken the United Kingdom’s and is the fourth-largest in the world. 

Live coronavirus updates: https://t.co/XGqFnZYhtm

name: nytimes
text: In the first verdict of its kind, a South Korean court has ruled that Kara Bos, a woman adopted by an American couple almost 4 decades ago, must be recognized as a daughter of an 85-year-old South Korean man https://t.co/DhRpwj2cX9

name: nytimes
text: Zoom acknowledged that the Chinese government had contacted it about 4 meetings that would be hosted on the site to commemorate the Tiananmen Square crackdown. The government asked Zoom to terminate the accounts hosting the calls, which it did in 3 cases. https://t.co/qW9MThG3wT

name: nytimes
text: Poaching of jaguars in South and Central America increased 200-fold over just 5 years, and a new study links their slaughter to corruption as well as investment from Chinese companies  https://t.co/ScT4YD5F0f

name: nytimes
text: Goldman Sachs is trying to get federal prosecutors to ease up on the bank for its role in a brazen scheme to loot billions of dollars from a Malaysian sovereign wealth fund https://t.co/4e6OGTb5Jd

name: nytimes
text: Is it safe for kids to return to reopened playgrounds? Here's what we know. https://t.co/rqXMxGzdmY

name: nytimes
text: U.S. lawmakers are considering investing tens of billions of dollars in America’s semiconductor industry over the next 5 to 10 years to help the United States retain an edge over China https://t.co/fxhPtVkaLS

name: nytimes
text:
In Opinion

Gurminder K Bhambra writes, "The glorification of the British Empire despite its histories of colonization, plunder and enslavement is evident in the plethora of statues to its architects"
https://t.co/ofMiLBcZfH

name: nytimes
text: As European cities emerge from quarantines, bicycles are playing a central role in getting the work force moving again. Miles of pop-up “corona cycleways” had been laid. https://t.co/Hem1mmdAkG

name: nytimes
text: A new wave of anti-government protests erupted across Lebanon after the Lebanese pound sank to a new low against the U.S. dollar, obliterating the purchasing power of many Lebanese https://t.co/Vvp7VLUIwg

name: nytimes
text: In a statement marking the second anniversary of a historic summit meeting between Kim Jong-un and President Trump, North Korea said hopes of diplomacy had “faded away into a dark nightmare,” and vowed to increase its nuclear weapons capabilities https://t.co/A8Hw0XRsjK

text: Here's a rundown of the highlights worth watching from late-night TV https://t.co/E6iq9J9f6q

name: nytimes
text: “I think about the death of the human race. The long strange trip of the naked ape,” Bob Dylan said in a rare, wide-ranging interview about mortality, history and his new album, “Rough and Rowdy Ways,” his first album of original songs since 2012 https://t.co/htHNzQUcn5

name: nytimes
text: Democrats have taken to calling out the problem of “systemic racism.” But some say politicians are using the language of systemic change but stopping short of the more radical policies to address it. https://t.co/NDX3T3yZtl

name: nytimes
text: The Trump administration proposed a rule this week that would raise the standard of proof for migrants hoping to obtain asylum and is expected to propose additional visa restrictions https://t.co/ZkHjVx2LqU

name: nytimes
text: In Los Angeles and Chicago, teachers’ unions are pushing to get the police out of schools. Some black teachers and students, in particular, say they consider officers on campus a danger. https://t.co/ghsRit62u3

text: Video: Protesters left a trail of red paint behind them to symbolize blood on the New York City streets as they marched to oppose police brutality and racism in the criminal justice system https://t.co/es5PZv6C38

text:

text:

https://t.co/hEtDM6LA9z

name: nytimes
text:

https://t.co/t7GNGo8iz4

name: nytimes
text: We wanted to know how people who are living together — romantically or otherwise — have fared after months of sheltering at home. Here are 18 stories of isolating together. https://t.co/bHu4ozH6lx

name: nytimes
text:

https://t.co/zpRZHBMmhq

name: nytimes
text:

w/ @VVFriedman  https://t.co/oBBRYbtsoh

name: nytimes
text:
Bubba Wallace is the only black driver in NASCAR’s top-flight racing series. He called on Monday for Confederate flags to be removed from NASCAR events, and on Wednesday, the organization announced that the flags were banned.
https://t.co/GKY6hJPdda

name: nytimes
text: Pride events scheduled for Boston, New York, San Francisco and elsewhere have moved almost exclusively online this year, giving members of the LGBTQ community and their allies who haven’t been able to attend a new way to participate. Here’s a schedule: https://t.co/raiJlZMJDb

name: nytimes
text: Sterling Higgins, a black man in Tennessee, called the police in March 2019 and told them someone was following him and trying to kill him. He died in police custody after a struggle captured in newly released video that is now part of a lawsuit. https://t.co/ISeg5the1R

name: nytimes
text:
RT @emilymbadger: Do you have any idea what share of public spending in your city goes to the police?

I had no clue prior to this week. Turns out, for large cities, it’s generally about 8 percent.
https://t.co/ZY0bMZixsQ

text: Starbucks said on Friday that employees would be allowed to wear Black Lives Matter shirts and pins, a sudden reversal of a company policy that had banned the phrase https://t.co/zegGMpsakM

name: nytimes
text:

https://t.co/8r19M3ownr

name: nytimes
text:
